champ.champInfo:
The direct organization and conduct of the competition is entrusted to the NGO "Ukrainian Federation of Kyokushin Budo Karate Kenbukai", the organizing committee and the main panel of judges, assigned to this competition. The organizer of the competition is the sports club "MONOLIT" represented by the NGO "Ukrainian Federation Kyokushin Budo Karate".

Organizing committee and judges:

  • The chief judge of the competition is Viktor Nguyen, 2nd dan (Kyiv), tel. +38(099)-907-07-05
  • Organizational issues and settlements — Anastasia Nguyen, (Kyiv), tel. +38(068)-331-00-37
  • Technical support — Ihor Tatarchenko, (Lviv), tel. +38(067)-788-77-28

Venue of the competition: Sports Academy, 14 Shevchenko St., Bucha, Kyiv region.

The competition will be held on June 1-2, 2024.

Competition program

June 1 (Saturday)
Athletes of categories U5, U7, U15, U17 and U35

  • 07:30 – 09:30 Registration of all teams, mandate committee in the "kumite" section
  • 09:00 – 09:30 Jury meeting
  • 09:30 - 12:30 Matches
  • 14:00 – 14:30 Awarding of competition winners and prize-winners
  • 15:00 closing of the competition

June 02 (Sunday)
Athletes of categories U9, U11, U13

  • 07:30 – 09:30 Registration of all teams, mandate committee in the "kumite" section
  • 09:00 – 09:30 Jury meeting
  • 09:30 – 12:30 Matches in U9 categories. After the matches - awards
  • 13:00 – 13:30 Opening ceremony of the competition. Lining up of athletes
  • 13:30 – 16:00 Matches in categories U11-U13.After the matches - awards
  • 17:00 closing of the competition

Competition rules.

  • Competitions in the "kumite" section are held according to the Olympic system with elimination after defeat
  • The team representative reserves the right to weigh the opponent before the start of the match. In the case of exceeding the permissible error in weight in the category (300g), without taking into account the full equipment (2kg), the rival athlete is automatically subject to disqualification
  • The competition organizer reserves the right to combine categories in case of insufficient number of participants - less than 4 participants in a category.
  • If the athlete does not appear on the tatami after the announcement of his name within 1 minute, the athlete will be considered defeated
  • Categories in which there are less than 8 participants, matches for 3rd place are held. Categories in which there are 8 or more athletes - without a match for 3rd place, are awarded with two thirds
  • An appeal may be filed only by a team representative who participated in referee seminar, declared at least 2 referees from his team. Application for appeal submitted in written free form with an indication of the reason for protesting the decision judges and video recording of the match. Together with the statement, the team representative leaves deposit in the amount of 500 hryvnias.In the event of a change in the decision of the match in favor representative of the team - funds are returned in full

Series B1 - participants with qualification 0 - 7 kyu (for adults)
Series B - participants with qualification 0 - 9 kyu
Series A1 - participants with qualifications from 6 kyu (for adults)
Series A - participants with qualifications from 8 kyu

Categories of participants:

Kumite:
Age Gender Weight categories Series
4-5 Guys -20 +20 Series A and B combined
4-5 Girls -20 +20 Series A and B combined
6-7 Young men -20 -25 -30 -35 -40 -50 Series A and B separately
6-7 Girls -25 -30 -40 Series A and B separately
8-9 Young men -25 -30 -35 -40 -45 -55 Series A and B separately
8-9 Girls -25 -30 -35 -45 Series A and B separately
10-11 Young men -30 -35 -40 -45 -50 -60 Series A and B separately
10-11 Girls -35 -40 -45 -55 Series A and B separately
12-13 Young men -40 -45 -50 -55 -60 -70 Series A and B separately
12-13 Girls -40 -45 -50 -60 Series A and B separately
14-15 Young men -45 -50 -55 -60 -65 -80 Series A and B separately
14-15 Girls -50 -55 -60 -75 Series A and B separately
16-17 Young men -55 -60 -65 -70 -75 -90 Series A and B separately
16-17 Girls -50 -55 -60 -75 Series A and B separately
18-35 Men Absolute Weight Series A1 and B1 separately
18-35 Women Absolute Weight Series A1 and B1 separately

Rules of matches

  • Children: boys and girls U5-U9:
    • qualifying matches - 1 min. + 1 min with a mandatory solution
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1 min. + 1 min. + weighing + 1 min. The difference in weight is 2 kg
  • Children: boys and girls U11:
    • Qualifying matches: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. with a binding decision
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.5 min. The difference in weight is 2 kg
  • Children: boys and girls U13:
    • qualifying matches - Qualifying matches: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. with a binding decision
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.5 min. The difference in weight is 3 kg
  • Boys and girls U15, U17:
    • qualifying matches - Qualifying matches: 2 min. + 2 min. with a binding decision
    • Semifinal and final matches: 2 min. + 2 min. + weighing + 2 min. The difference in weight is 3 kg
  • Men and women:
    • qualifying matches - Qualifying matches: 3 min. + 2 min. with a binding decision
    • Semifinal and final matches: 3 min. + 2 min. + weighing + 2 min. The difference in weight is 10 kg

IMPORTANTLY! Series B and Series B1, the duration of the match for all age categories is 1 minute.!!!

Awards

  • Participants are awarded diplomas, medals and cups for prize places (1st - 3rd place) in each age category
  • Athletes aged 4-9 years inclusive, who did not take the prize place, are awarded prizes from the sponsors of the competition
  • Sportsmen in the nominations "Best Fighter" among girls and boys are awarded with sports equipment - bicycles and scooters
  • Teams that took 1-5 prize places inclusively, are awarded cash prizes from the organizer of the competition. Team places are calculated based on the results coaches' medal tally

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until May 25, 2024

Financial costs

  • Direct financing of the event rests with the organizer, in the person of Victor Nguyen
  • Charity contribution for participation in the competition - UAH 850.
